intro: Afrocanthium gilfillanii, commonly known as the African grassleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers in composite inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Afrocanthium gilfillanii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
